people.name: Wori
people.info: Wori was the elder brother among the three founding brothers of the Malari sub-clan. He grew up with his brothers Dabe and an unnamed younger brother. After the younger brother's death, Wori suspected the widow Landu of complicity and demanded investigation, leading to consultations with witch doctors. His actions intensified family conflicts, including attempts to execute Landu and ongoing animosity with Dabe. Wori married an unnamed wife who later died, allegedly due to witchcraft from Dabe's side. His lineage remained sketchy in oral history, but descendants include Rabuk Kabur Lobiji and grandchildren. Wori's pursuit of 'justice' through unproductive methods like witch doctors contributed to the split of the Malari clan into mainstream Malari and Jonyari.

people.name: Dabe
people.info: Dabe was the middle brother of the three founding brothers of the Malari sub-clan. He opposed Wori's unfounded suspicions against Landu, the widow of their younger brother, and challenged the clan's verdict to execute her. Dabe secretly inherited Landu and bore children with her, including Koboji, Lopia, and an unnamed son. He married a legitimate unnamed wife who bore only daughters but left jealously when Landu gave birth to a son. Dabe's resentment against the clan's actions led him to abort the assassination of Landu. Conflicts with Wori escalated through reciprocal witchcraft, culminating in Wori's wife's death and Dabe's assassination by her relatives. Shot with an arrow while urinating outside, Dabe fought back, killing three attackers, but died from septic injury. His last words instructed Landu to flee to Liwolo with their baby Koboji and a specific cow named Songo for sustenance. Biologically the father of Jonyari descendants, but culturally considered the uncle as the children belonged to his late younger brother.

people.name: Younger Brother (Name Unknown)
people.info: The youngest of the three brothers who formed the Malari sub-clan. He married Landu from Liwolo but died under incomprehensible circumstances, possibly without children, as there are no references to his descendants. His death sparked suspicions from Wori, leading to clan conflicts. Culturally, he is considered the father of the children borne by Landu after inheritance by Dabe, including Koboji and his brothers.

people.name: Landu
people.info: Landu was from Liwolo and the wife of the unnamed younger brother. After his death, she was accused by Wori of complicity and nearly executed based on a witch doctor's chicken ritual pointing to her. Saved by Dabe, who inherited her, she bore Koboji, Lopia, and an unnamed son. Following Dabe's death, she fled to her family in Liwolo with baby Koboji and the cow Songo, as per Dabe's instructions. She fulfilled mourning obligations and raised Koboji there. Landu is the ancestress of all Jonyari descendants, negating derogatory terms like 'inherited rutat' within the clan.

people.name: Unnamed Wife of Dabe
people.info: The legitimate wife of Dabe, name unknown. She bore only baby girls and became jealous when Dabe inherited Landu and bore a son. She left with her daughters to her family, and their whereabouts remain unknown to date. No further accounts of her or her descendants.

people.name: Unnamed Wife of Wori
people.info: The wife of Wori, name unknown. She died, allegedly due to witchcraft from Dabe's side in retaliation to Wori's actions. Her death outraged her relatives, leading to Dabe's assassination. No further details on her or immediate children, though Wori's lineage continues through descendants like Rabuk Kabur Lobiji.

people.name: Koboji
people.info: Koboji was the son of Dabe and his inherited wife Landu, culturally the son of the unnamed younger brother. As a baby, he fled with Landu to Liwolo after Dabe's death, raised by uncles there. He received a piece of land named Yibur, traditionally belonging to Jonyari grandchildren. Koboji married Likiya from Jingoro-Liwolo and fathered Moju, Lo’du, and Tongidyang. He defined his own identity by forming the Jonyari sub-clan, splintering from Malari. Second greatest grandparent in Jonyari hierarchy. His exile and potential return raise cultural questions about reconciliations with Wori's descendants.

people.name: Lopia
people.info: Lopia was a son of Dabe and Landu, culturally belonging to the unnamed younger brother. His history remains bleak with no further accounts about him or his descendants.

people.name: Unnamed Son of Landu
people.info: An unnamed son of Dabe and Landu, culturally belonging to the unnamed younger brother. His history remains bleak with no further accounts about him or his descendants.

people.name: Likiya
people.info: Likiya was from the clan of Jingoro-Liwolo and the wife of Koboji. She gave birth to Moju, Lo’du, and Tongidyang.

people.name: Rabuk Kabur Lobiji
people.info: Rabuk Kabur Lobiji is a continued descendant of Wori's lineage. The oral history of Wori's family is scarce, but Rabuk and his grandchildren represent this line of the Malari clan.

people.name: Moju
people.info: Moju was a son of Koboji and Likiya. He married an unnamed wife and fathered Landu (also known as Congo), Poni, and Joputo.

people.name: Lo’du
people.info: Lo’du was a son of Koboji and Likiya. He married Muggo from the clan of Saburi and fathered an unnamed baby boy before dying young. Muggo was then inherited by Wori Kau (a blacksmith, not blood-related), producing Lutan, who is culturally Jonyari via bride wealth.

people.name: Tongidyang
people.info: Tongidyang was a son of Koboji and Likiya. He married Suku from the clan of Korsak and fathered Dabe (Jr), Amunuki, and Lupai (Lubadu). The family experienced persistent deaths, leaving Lupai as the sole survivor, who was repatriated to Korsak uncles. No accounts about their sisters.

people.name: Unnamed Wife of Moju
people.info: The wife of Moju, name unknown. She gave birth to Landu (Congo), Poni, and Joputo.

people.name: Muggo
people.info: Muggo was from the clan of Saburi and wife of Lo’du. She gave birth to an unnamed baby boy with Lo’du. After Lo’du's death, she was inherited by Wori Kau and gave birth to Lutan.

people.name: Suku
people.info: Suku was from the clan of Korsak and wife of Tongidyang. She gave birth to Dabe (Jr), Amunuki, and Lupai.

people.name: Wori Kau
people.info: Wori Kau was a professional blacksmith (Tumunit) for the Jonyari, not blood-related. He inherited Muggo after Lo’du's death and fathered Lutan. The generation from this inheritance is culturally Jonyari due to bride wealth.

people.name: Landu (Congo)
people.info: Landu, also known as Congo, was a child of Moju and his unnamed wife. Gave birth to Yangi, Giye, Likiya, and Koboji (who died young).

people.name: Poni (of Moju)
people.info: Poni was a child of Moju and his unnamed wife. Nothing known about Poni's grandchildren.

people.name: Joputo
people.info: Joputo was a child of Moju and his unnamed wife. Gave birth to Jokudu, Lodiong, and Likiya.

people.name: Unnamed Baby Boy of Lo'du
people.info: The unnamed baby boy of Lo'du and Muggo. History unknown.

people.name: Lutan
people.info: Lutan was born to Muggo and Wori Kau after inheritance. Culturally Jonyari via bride wealth. Married Ijang and gave birth to Lupe and Anna Kiden. Also inherited an unnamed wife from elsewhere, mother of Roba Lokuli.

people.name: Dabe (Jr)
people.info: Dabe Jr was a son of Tongidyang and Suku. Married Doru from Romoggi-Liwolo and gave birth to Poni Na Dabe and Modi (died young). After his death, Lupai inherited Doru and bore Abrama Mogga (culturally Dabe's). Also married Giye from Liekor-Liwolo and gave birth to Nikademo Logbong and Priscilla Baye (mother of Bismarck Bungit), culturally his via bride wealth.

people.name: Amunuki
people.info: Amunuki was a son of Tongidyang and Suku. Engaged to Gire from Leikor-Liwolo, but died before wedding due to a taboo (howling during his marriage ceremony and mother-in-law's response). Bride wealth was paid, so Gire was considered his wife and inherited by Lupai. Death inconceivable and mind-juggling. Ancestor to Ebele Kitenge, Petero Koboji, Muja, Sarah Leong, and Modong.

people.name: Lupai (Lubadu or Moron)
people.info: Lupai, originally named Lubadu and nicknamed 'the rejected one' for unknown reasons, was the son of Tongidyang and Suku. Sole survivor of family misfortunes, repatriated to Korsak uncles as a mature married man with household. Inherited wives from brothers: Doru (bore Abrama Mogga), Giye (from Dabe Jr), and Gire (from Amunuki, bore Ebele Kitenge etc.). Married legitimate wife Raele Adede and bore Wani Bungu, Purumena Tutuan, Rebecca Juan, Morris Murye, and Elisabeta Yari. Ranked fourth in known grandparents. Bailed out from Korsak on March 3, 2012, to resolve social traits and misfortunes. Profile highlights exile due to family deaths and cultural practices.

people.name: Ijang
people.info: Ijang was the wife of Lutan. Gave birth to Lupe and Anna Kiden.

people.name: Unnamed Mother of Roba Lokuli
people.info: Inherited by Lutan from elsewhere. Gave birth to Roba Lokuli.

people.name: Doru
people.info: Doru was from Romoggi-Liwolo and first wife of Dabe Jr. Gave birth to Poni Na Dabe and Modi (died young). Inherited by Lupai after Dabe's death, bore Abrama Mogga (culturally Dabe's).

people.name: Giye (Wife of Dabe Jr)
people.info: Giye was from Liekor-Liwolo and second wife of Dabe Jr. Gave birth to Nikademo Logbong and Priscilla Baye (mother of Bismarck Bungit). Children culturally legitimate to Dabe.

people.name: Gire
people.info: Gire was the daughter of Buju from Leikor-Liwolo, engaged to Amunuki. Beautiful light-skinned lady admired by many. Eloped by a colonial master (Jaalia) after Amunuki's death but recovered diplomatically. Considered legitimate wife of Jonyari due to paid bride wealth. Developed wounds, suspected witchcraft, handed to Lupai who inherited her. Gave birth to Ebele Kitenge, Petero Koboji, Muja, Sarah Leong, and Modong (culturally Amunuki's).

people.name: Raele Adede (Wori Kajanyiri)
people.info: Raele Adede was from Kagiri in Bori-Kangapu ii Payam and the first legitimate wife of Lupai. Dispatched to Lupai amid concerns over his inheritances. Gave birth to Wani Bungu, Purumena Tutuan, Rebecca Juan, Morris Murye, and Elisabeta Yari. Traditionally the primary wife, with inherited wives referenced to their late husbands.

people.name: Yangi
people.info: Yangi was a child of Landu (Congo). No further details.

people.name: Giye (of Congo)
people.info: Giye was a child of Landu (Congo). No further details.

people.name: Likiya (of Congo)
people.info: Likiya was a child of Landu (Congo). No further details.

people.name: Koboji (of Congo)
people.info: Koboji was a child of Landu (Congo). Died young.

people.name: Jokudu
people.info: Jokudu was a child of Joputo. No further details.

people.name: Lodiong (of Joputo)
people.info: Lodiong was a child of Joputo. No further details.

people.name: Likiya (of Joputo)
people.info: Likiya was a child of Joputo. No further details.

people.name: Lupe
people.info: Yaba Lupe was a child of Lutan and Ijang. No further details.

people.name: Anna Kiden
people.info: Anna Kiden was a child of Lutan and Ijang. No further details.

people.name: Roba Lokuli
people.info: Roba Lokuli was a child of Lutan and his inherited unnamed wife. Married Marata Wori Gudi (daughter of Gudi) and gave birth to Mojule and others.

people.name: Poni Na Dabe
people.info: Poni, popularly known as Poni Na Dabe, was a child of Dabe Jr and Doru. No further details.

people.name: Modi
people.info: Modi was a child of Dabe Jr and Doru. Died young.

people.name: Abrama Mogga
people.info: Abrama Mogga was born to Doru and Lupai after inheritance, culturally child of Dabe Jr. Ancestor to Yisaka Piso, Lea Suku, Timoteo Tongidyang, Ryembe, Gordon Yama Lo’du, Grace Talata, Joseph Yanga, and Tola from first wife Elisabeta Ropi; Cyrus Tongidyang (Khamis Laila), Suku (Zande), Joyce Kiden (Yanya), and Henry Jenge from second wife Grace Juan; Richard Taban (Tongidyang), Sylvia Suku (Dudu), and Monday from third wife Pilista Juru (separated by Anyanya war, other children out of wedlock - cultural status questionable).

people.name: Nikademo Logbong
people.info: Nikademo Logbong was a child of Dabe Jr and Giye. Culturally legitimate to Dabe. No further details.

people.name: Priscilla Baye
people.info: Priscilla Baye was a child of Dabe Jr and Giye. Mother of Bismarck Bungit. Culturally legitimate to Dabe.

people.name: Ebele Kitenge (Doko or Gubaji)
people.info: Ebele Kitenge, sometimes called Doko or Gubaji, was born to Gire and Lupai, culturally child of Amunuki. Father of Gamba, Stanley Roba, Nicolas Buju, Suku, Ijang, Kabudu, and Tongidyang (Dwoki) from first wife Sokale; Taban Abel (Yamba), Suku (Wiling-wiling), Makka, Yata, Kenyi John, and Lo’du Bismarck from second wife Yanya from Wandi clan.

people.name: Petero Koboji
people.info: Petero Koboji was born to Gire and Lupai, culturally child of Amunuki. Father of Sokiri, Joselin Juan (Wori Giye), Pita Na Petero, Ko’do, Buju, Tongidyang, and Abate.

people.name: Muja
people.info: Muja was born to Gire and Lupai, culturally child of Amunuki. No further details.

people.name: Sarah Leong
people.info: Sarah Leong was born to Gire and Lupai, culturally child of Amunuki. No further details.

people.name: Modong (of Amunuki)
people.info: Modong was born to Gire and Lupai, culturally child of Amunuki. No further details.

people.name: Wani (Bungu)
people.info: Wani, commonly known as Bungu, was a child of Lupai and Raele Adede. Married Tabita Yobu and gave birth to Wilson Lodiong, Sartiele Yama Lo’du, Charity Suku, and Kiryembe; from second wife Kaku gave birth to William Wolyan, Escesles Nnyarsuk, and Joy Yine. There were others born out of wedlock.

people.name: Purumena Logborong (Tutuan)
people.info: Purumena, also called Tutuan, was a child of Lupai and Raele Adede. Descendants include Gordon Sula, Maika Duke, Charles Lisi, Milton Wani, Jaguru, and Yine from first wife Maria Woro of Wandi; Bulson Bulli, Simon Ladu, Modong, Guo, and Augustino Wolyan from second wife Juan of Pojulu; Taban Nelson (Tongidyang), Suku, Dudu, Subek Nandera, Emmanuel Lo’du, Bongiri, Doru, and Muggo from third wife Poni Na Kei. Others born out of wedlock.

people.name: Rebecca Juan
people.info: Rebecca Juan was a child of Lupai and Raele Adede. No further details.

people.name: Morris Murye
people.info: Morris Murye was a child of Lupai and Raele Adede. Descendants include Pita, Azaria Wolyan, Chaplain Soso (Tongidyang), Simon Wolyan, Cecelia Yine, Joseph Loguli, Rejoice Poni, Julius Bongo, and Oliver Losuba (Gwolo) from first wife Rebecca Kiden of Loringa-Bura; Nora 'Balai, Helda Suku, Rasulia Modong, Wanijo, Lucia Yanya, Isso (Gire), Mama, Margret Yine, and Muggo from second wife Christina 'Diko of Wandi. Murye lived for an estimated 55years, and then he unfornately passed on. He was mourned and buried on 26th-Februry, 1979 in Boro-boro.

people.name: Rebecca Kiden
people.info: Rebecca Kiden was the daughter of Wani-Konyi from Loringa-Bura clan and first legitimate wife of Morris Murye. Gave birth to Pita, Azaria Wolyan, Chaplain Soso (Tongidyang), Simon Wolyan, Cecelia Yine, Joseph Loguli, Rejoice Poni, Julius Bongo, and Oliver Losuba (Gwolo). She was believed have lived for an estimated 72 years of age and she finally died and was mourned and buried on unkwnon date around the year 2002/2003 in Dongoda village.

people.name: Christina 'Diko
people.info: Christina 'Diko was from the Wandi clan and second legitimate wife of Morris Murye. Gave birth to Nora 'Balai, Helda Suku, Rasulia Modong, Wanijo, Lucia Yanya, Isso (Gire), Mama, Margret Yine, and Muggo.

people.name: Elisabeta Yari
people.info: Elisabeta Yari was a child of Lupai and Raele Adede. Denied education by brothers, leading to illusions interpreted as potential curse on girl child education in the clan, but forgiven and resolved during bailout occasion.

people.name: Marata Wori Gudi
people.info: Marata was the daughter of Gudi and wife of Roba Lokuli. Gave birth to Mojule and others.

people.name: Elisabeta Ropi
people.info: Elisabeta Ropi was the first legitimate wife of Abrama Mogga. Gave birth to Yisaka Piso, Lea Suku, Timoteo Tongidyang, Ryembe, Gordon Yama Lo’du, Grace Talata, Joseph Yanga, and Tola.

people.name: Grace Juan
people.info: Grace Juan was the daughter of Boro from Dongoro and second legitimate wife of Abrama Mogga. Gave birth to Cyrus Tongidyang (Khamis Laila), Suku (Zande), Joyce Kiden (Yanya), and Henry Jenge.

people.name: Pilista Juru
people.info: Pilista Juru was the third legitimate wife of Abrama Mogga. Separated by Anyanya war, gave birth to Richard Taban (Tongidyang), Sylvia Suku (Dudu), and Monday; bore other children out of wedlock, cultural status as Jonyari questionable.

people.name: Sokale
people.info: Sokale was the first legitimate wife of Ebele Kitenge. Gave birth to Gamba, Stanley Roba, Nicolas Buju, Suku, Ijang, Kabudu, and Tongidyang (Dwoki).

people.name: Yanya (of Wandi)
people.info: Yanya was from the Wandi clan and second legitimate wife of Ebele Kitenge. Gave birth to Taban Abel (Yamba), Suku (Wiling-wiling), Makka, Yata, Kenyi John, and Lo’du Bismarck.

people.name: Tabita Yobu
people.info: Tabita Yobu was the first legitimate wife of Wani Bungu. Gave birth to Wilson Lodiong, Sartiele Yama Lo’du, Charity Suku, and Kiryembe. Involved in family concerns, including a resolved incident with Lena regarding pension entitlements.

people.name: Kaku
people.info: Kaku was the second legitimate wife of Wani Bungu. Gave birth to William Wolyan, Escesles Nnyarsuk, and Joy Yine.

people.name: Maria Woro
people.info: Maria Woro was from the Wandi clan and first legitimate wife of Purumena Tutuan. Gave birth to Gordon Sula, Maika Duke, Charles Lisi, Milton Wani, Jaguru, and Yine.

people.name: Juan (of Pojulu)
people.info: Juan was from the Pojulu clan of Gaderu and second legitimate wife of Purumena Tutuan. Gave birth to Bulson Bulli, Simon Ladu, Modong, Guo, and Augustino Wolyan.

people.name: Poni Na Kei
people.info: Poni Na Kei was the daughter of Kei and third legitimate wife of Purumena Tutuan. Gave birth to Taban Nelson (Tongidyang), Suku, Dudu, Subek Nandera, Emmanuel Lo’du, Bongiri, Doru, and Muggo.

people.name: Mojule
people.info: Mojule was a child of Roba Lokuli and Marata Wori Gudi. Others unknown.

people.name: Yisaka Piso
people.info: Yisaka Piso was a child of Abrama Mogga and Elisabeta Ropi. No further details.

people.name: Lea Suku
people.info: Lea Suku was a child of Abrama Mogga and Elisabeta Ropi. No further details.

people.name: Timoteo Tongidyang
people.info: Timoteo Tongidyang was a child of Abrama Mogga and Elisabeta Ropi. No further details.

people.name: Ryembe
people.info: Ryembe was a child of Abrama Mogga and Elisabeta Ropi. No further details.

people.name: Gordon Yama Lo'du
people.info: Gordon Yama Lo'du was a child of Abrama Mogga and Elisabeta Ropi. No further details.

people.name: Grace Talata
people.info: Grace Talata was a child of Abrama Mogga and Elisabeta Ropi. No further details.

people.name: Joseph Yanga
people.info: Joseph Yanga was a child of Abrama Mogga and Elisabeta Ropi. No further details.

people.name: Tola
people.info: Tola was a child of Abrama Mogga and Elisabeta Ropi. No further details.

people.name: Cyrus Tongidyang (Khamis Laila)
people.info: Cyrus Tongidyang, sometimes called Khamis Laila, was a child of Abrama Mogga and Grace Juan. No further details.

people.name: Suku (Zande)
people.info: Suku, also called Zande, was a child of Abrama Mogga and Grace Juan. No further details.

people.name: Joyce Kiden (Yanya)
people.info: Joyce Kiden, also known as Yanya, was a child of Abrama Mogga and Grace Juan. No further details.

people.name: Henry Jenge
people.info: Henry Jenge was a child of Abrama Mogga and Grace Juan. No further details.

people.name: Richard Taban (Tongidyang)
people.info: Richard Taban, also called Tongidyang, was a child of Abrama Mogga and Pilista Juru. No further details.

people.name: Sylvia Suku (Dudu)
people.info: Sylvia Suku, also called Dudu, was a child of Abrama Mogga and Pilista Juru. No further details.

people.name: Monday
people.info: Monday was a child of Abrama Mogga and Pilista Juru. No further details.

people.name: Gamba
people.info: Gamba was a child of Ebele Kitenge and Sokale. No further details.

people.name: Stanley Roba
people.info: Stanley Roba was a child of Ebele Kitenge and Sokale. No further details.

people.name: Nicolas Buju
people.info: Nicolas Buju was a child of Ebele Kitenge and Sokale. No further details.

people.name: Suku (of Ebele)
people.info: Suku was a child of Ebele Kitenge and Sokale. No further details.

people.name: Ijang (of Ebele)
people.info: Ijang was a child of Ebele Kitenge and Sokale. No further details.

people.name: Kabudu
people.info: Kabudu was a child of Ebele Kitenge and Sokale. No further details.

people.name: Tongidyang (Dwoki)
people.info: Tongidyang, sometimes called Dwoki, was a child of Ebele Kitenge and Sokale. No further details.

people.name: Taban Abel (Yamba)
people.info: Taban Abel, also called Yamba, was a child of Ebele Kitenge and Yanya. No further details.

people.name: Suku (Wiling-wiling)
people.info: Suku, sometimes called Wiling-wiling, was a child of Ebele Kitenge and Yanya. No further details.

people.name: Makka
people.info: Makka was a child of Ebele Kitenge and Yanya. No further details.

people.name: Yata
people.info: Yata was a child of Ebele Kitenge and Yanya. No further details.

people.name: Kenyi John
people.info: Kenyi John was a child of Ebele Kitenge and Yanya. No further details.

people.name: Lo'du Bismarck
people.info: Lo'du Bismarck was a child of Ebele Kitenge and Yanya. No further details.

people.name: Sokiri
people.info: Sokiri was a child of Petero Koboji. No further details.

people.name: Joselin Juan (Wori Giye)
people.info: Joselin Juan, also called Wori Giye, was a child of Petero Koboji. No further details.

people.name: Pita Na Petero
people.info: Pita Na Petero was a child of Petero Koboji. No further details.

people.name: Ko'do
people.info: Ko'do was a child of Petero Koboji. No further details.

people.name: Buju (of Petero)
people.info: Buju was a child of Petero Koboji. No further details.

people.name: Tongidyang (of Petero)
people.info: Tongidyang was a child of Petero Koboji. No further details.

people.name: Abate
people.info: Abate was a child of Petero Koboji. No further details.

people.name: Wilson Lodiong
people.info: Wilson Lodiong was a child of Wani Bungu and Tabita Yobu. Family concerns about his unsettled children, including Lena, Lemi, and Larvina (who later settled). Incidents like maid's suicide and pension dispute with Tabita resolved.

people.name: Sartiele Yama Lo'du
people.info: Sartiele Yama Lo'du was a child of Wani Bungu and Tabita Yobu. No further details.

people.name: Charity Suku
people.info: Charity Suku was a child of Wani Bungu and Tabita Yobu. No further details.

people.name: Kiryembe
people.info: Kiryembe was a child of Wani Bungu and Tabita Yobu. No further details.

people.name: William Wolyan
people.info: William Wolyan was a child of Wani Bungu and Kaku. No further details.

people.name: Escesles Nnyarsuk
people.info: Escesles Nnyarsuk was a child of Wani Bungu and Kaku. No further details.

people.name: Joy Yine
people.info: Joy Yine was a child of Wani Bungu and Kaku. No further details.

people.name: Gordon Sula
people.info: Gordon Sula was a child of Purumena Tutuan and Maria Woro. No further details.

people.name: Maika Duke
people.info: Maika Duke was a child of Purumena Tutuan and Maria Woro. No further details.

people.name: Charles Lisi
people.info: Charles Lisi was a child of Purumena Tutuan and Maria Woro. No further details.

people.name: Milton Wani
people.info: Milton Wani was a child of Purumena Tutuan and Maria Woro. No further details.

people.name: Jaguru
people.info: Jaguru was a child of Purumena Tutuan and Maria Woro. No further details.

people.name: Yine (of Purumena)
people.info: Yine was a child of Purumena Tutuan and Maria Woro. No further details.

people.name: Bulson Bulli
people.info: Bulson Bulli was a child of Purumena Tutuan and Juan. No further details.

people.name: Simon Ladu
people.info: Simon Ladu was a child of Purumena Tutuan and Juan. No further details.

people.name: Modong (of Purumena)
people.info: Modong was a child of Purumena Tutuan and Juan. No further details.

people.name: Guo
people.info: Guo was a child of Purumena Tutuan and Juan. No further details.

people.name: Augustino Wolyan
people.info: Augustino Wolyan was a child of Purumena Tutuan and Juan. No further details.

people.name: Taban Nelson (Tongidyang)
people.info: Taban Nelson, also called Tongidyang, was a child of Purumena Tutuan and Poni Na Kei. No further details.

people.name: Suku (of Poni Na Kei)
people.info: Suku was a child of Purumena Tutuan and Poni Na Kei. No further details.

people.name: Dudu (of Poni Na Kei)
people.info: Dudu was a child of Purumena Tutuan and Poni Na Kei. No further details.

people.name: Subek Nandera
people.info: Subek Nandera was a child of Purumena Tutuan and Poni Na Kei. No further details.

people.name: Emmanuel Lo'du
people.info: Emmanuel Lo'du was a child of Purumena Tutuan and Poni Na Kei. No further details.

people.name: Bongiri
people.info: Bongiri was a child of Purumena Tutuan and Poni Na Kei. No further details.

people.name: Doru (of Poni Na Kei)
people.info: Doru was a child of Purumena Tutuan and Poni Na Kei. No further details.

people.name: Muggo (of Poni Na Kei)
people.info: Muggo was a child of Purumena Tutuan and Poni Na Kei. No further details.

people.name: Pita (of Morris)
people.info: Pita was a child of Morris Murye and Rebecca Kiden. No further details.

people.name: Azaria Wolyan
people.info: Azaria Wolyan was a child of Morris Murye and Rebecca Kiden. Key informant for the clan history, providing invaluable knowledge and clarifications.

people.name: Kwaje Rebecca
people.info: Kwaje is the legitimate one and only wife of Azaria Wolyan, the mother Lodu Simya, Lupai Lawrence, Adede Rebecca, Wani Azaria and Poni Grace.

people.name: Chaplain Soso (Tongidyang)
people.info: Chaplain Soso, also called Tongidyang, was a child of Morris Murye and Rebecca Kiden. No further details.

people.name: Modong Na Soso
people.info: Modong Na Soso is the one and only wife of Chaplain Soso Tongidyang, the mother of Adede Asanti, Kojo Soso, Poni Soso, Wani Soso, Peace Soso and Joshua Soso.

people.name: Simon Wolyan
people.info: Simon Wolyan was a child of Morris Murye and Rebecca Kiden. No further details.

people.name: Cecelia Yine
people.info: Cecelia Yine was a child of Morris Murye and Rebecca Kiden. She married Gale from a Kakwa tribe and bore him Abe Emmanuel, Diko Jacob, kiden Elizabeth, Tabu Gloria, Amalia Stella and Poni Phionah.

people.name: Joseph Loguli
people.info: Joseph Loguli was a child of Morris Murye and Rebecca Kiden. No further details.

people.name: Rejoice Poni
people.info: Rejoice Poni was a child of Morris Murye and Rebecca Kiden. No further details.

people.name: Julius Bongo
people.info: Julius Bongo was a child of Morris Murye and Rebecca Kiden. No further details.

people.name: Rejoice Jaguru
people.info: Rejoice Jaguru is the first wife of Julius Bongo and mother to Annet Adede, Late Pamela Poni, Emmanuel Wani, Evaline Juru, Late Gladis Yangi and Kiden Patience.

people.name: Juan Na Bongo
people.info: Juan is the second wife of Julius Bongo. The mother of Kenyi Godwill, Lupai Surprise, Wani Bongo, Poni Julius and Adede Bongo.

people.name: Isso (Na Rebecca Kiden)
people.info: Isso Na Rebecca was a child of Morris Murye and Rebecca Kiden but died a baby. No further details.

people.name: Oliver Losuba (Gwolo)
people.info: Oliver Losuba, also called Gwolo, was a child of Morris Murye and Rebecca Kiden. No further details.

people.name: Muja Cecelia
people.info: Muja Cecelia is the first wife of Losuba Oliver. She married Losuba Oliver in 1992. She is the proud mother of Poni Esther, The twin (Fraser Loku and Kenyi Losuba), Lupai Sete, Thomas Mogga, Evaline Poni, Stella Adede, and Harriet Kajogo.

people.name: Esther Woro
people.info: Esther Woro is the second wife of Losuba Oliver. She married Losuba Oliver in the year 2002. She is the mother of Moju Losuba, Kiden Robina, Desstiny Jijo, Rose Adede, and Keji Scovia.

people.name: Simisona Mogga Loyangi
people.info: Simisona Mogga Loyangi is the father of Muja Cecelia. He belongs to the Wandi Mangole clan and is from Gaderu Boma. He is the grandfather of the children born to Losuba Oliver through his second marriage.

people.name: Yowani Tongun
people.info: Yowani Tongun is the father of Esther Woro. He belongs to the elder generation of the lineage connected to Losuba Oliver through his first marriage.

people.name: Jesilen Juan
people.info: Jesilen Juan wife of Simsona Mogga, the mother of Muja Cecelia. She belongs to the Worongo clan and is from Liwolo Payam.

people.name: Taibe Jijo
people.info: Taibe Jijo is the mother of Esther Woro, the second wife of Losuba Oliver. She belongs to the Wanya clan from Gaderu.

people.name: Gale
people.info: Gale is the legitimate husband of Cecelia Yine and he fathered Abe Emmanuel, Diko Jacob, kiden Elizabeth, Tabu Gloria, Amalia Stella and Poni Phionah.

people.name: Nora 'Balai
people.info: Nora 'Balai was a child of Morris Murye and Christina 'Diko. No further details.

people.name: Helda Suku
people.info: Helda Suku was a child of Morris Murye and Christina 'Diko. No further details.

people.name: Rasulia Modong
people.info: Rasulia Modong was a child of Morris Murye and Christina 'Diko. No further details.

people.name: Wanijo
people.info: Wanijo was a child of Morris Murye and Christina 'Diko. No further details.

people.name: Lucia Yanya
people.info: Lucia Yanya was a child of Morris Murye and Christina 'Diko. No further details.

people.name: Isso Gire
people.info: Isso, also called Gire, was a child of Morris Murye and Christina 'Diko. No further details.

people.name: Kulid Mama (of Christina)
people.info: Kulid was a child of Morris Murye and Christina 'Diko. No further details.

people.name: Margret Yine
people.info: Margret Yine was a child of Morris Murye and Christina 'Diko. No further details.

people.name: Muggo (of Christina)
people.info: Muggo was a child of Morris Murye and Christina 'Diko. No further details.

people.name: Bismarck Bungit
people.info: Bismarck Bungit was the son of Priscilla Baye. Father unknown. No further details.

people.name: Juan Edina
people.info: Juan Edina is the first born daughter of Azaria Wolyan and Rebecca Kweja. She was married to Kenyi Evance from the clan of Moje na Kolondobong in Lori, Nyepo. She gave birth to Kiden Glory, Reja Christine, Murye Emmanuel, Evaline Jogo, Samson Bulli and lastly Poni Beatrice

people.name: Lo'du Simaya
people.info: Simaya is the second and first born male child of Azaria Wolyan and Rebecca Kwaje. He fathered Kiden Pamela, Gonya Annet, Lodu Simaya, Murye Joel, Jogo Hellen, Poni Simaya and Kojo Simaya from first wife Modong Rejoice, and Munduwa Simaya, 'Diko Beatrice,Pitia Simaya and Kiden Simaya from second wife Suzan Kiko.

people.name: Lupai Lawrence
people.info: Lawrence is the son of Azaria Wolyan and Kwaje. He fathered Kenyi Charles, Murye Emmanuel, Unknown baby girl, Kiden Sarah, Jale David, Bulli Isaac and Losu Joshua from his legitimate wife Jane Kaku

people.name: Suku Na Azaria
people.info: Suku was a daughter of Azaria and Kweja. She died at a younger age

people.name: Adede Nancy
people.info: Nancy is a daughter of Azaria and Kwaje. She is married to Boyo Moses Maku from the clan of Romogi and produced Kiden Beatrice, Desire Kiden, Jogo Mercy, Murye Savior and Justo Igga

people.name: Wani Bennard
people.info: Bennard is the son of Azaria and Kwaje. He fathered Nelson Bulli from his wife Robina Apayi, and he had Kiden Samirah, Murye Bennard, Milla Bennard and Bulli Bennard from Stella Atimaku

people.name: Lomudu Felex
people.info: Felex was the seventh and last child of Azaria and Kwaje. He unfortunately died at an earlier age

people.name: Abe Emmanuel
people.info: Abe is the first born son of Cecelia Yine and Gale.

people.name: Diko Jacob
people.info: Jacob is the son of Cecelia Yine and Gale.

people.name: Kiden Elizabeth
people.info: Kiden Elizabeth also known as Betty is the daughter of Cecelia Yine and Gale.

people.name: Tabu Gloria
people.info: Gloria is a daughter of Cecelia Yine and Gale.

people.name: Grace Akulya
people.info: Akulya is the daughter of Cecelia Yine and Gale.

people.name: Amalia Stella
people.info: Stella is the second last born daughter of Cecelia Yine and Gale.

people.name: Poni Phionah
people.info: Phionah is the youngest daughter of Cecelia Yine and Gale.

people.name: Adede Annet
people.info: Annet is the first born child of Bongo Julius and Rejoice Jaguru. She is married to Dilla Theophilus and they have two children together, Jason Sakor Dilla and Peggy Kongo Dilla. Annet also has a son named Moses Pitia, fathered by Jacob Kamilo.

people.name: Poni Pamela
people.info: Pamela was the second born daughter of Bongo Julius and Rejoice Jaguru.

people.name: Emmanuel Wani
people.info: Emmanuel Wani, commonly known as Tella, is the third born and the only son of Bongo Julius and Rejoice Jaguru.

people.name: Evaline Juru
people.info: Juru is the fourth born daughter of Bongo Julius and Rejoice Jaguru. Named by her mother after her grandmother Juru 'Nyola.

people.name: Gladis Yangi
people.info: Gladis was the fifth born daughter of Bongo Julius and Rejoice Jaguru. She unfortunately passed away at a very young age due to illness in Waliji refugee settlement.

people.name: Kiden Patience
people.info: Patience is the sixth and last born daughter of Bongo Julius and Rejoice Jaguru. She was born in Mundari Civil Hospital

people.name: Kenyi Godwill
people.info: Kenyi is the first born son of Bongo Julius and Juan Julius.

people.name: Lupai Surprise
people.info: Surprise is the second born daughter of Bongo Julius and Juan Julius.

people.name: Wani Bongo
people.info: Wani Bongo is the third born son of Bongo Julius and Juan Julius.

people.name: Poni Na Bongo
people.info: Poni is the fourth born daughter of Bongo Julius and Juan Julius.

people.name: Adede Na Bongo
people.info: Adede Na Bongo is the fifth and last born daughter of Bongo Julius and Juan Julius.

people.name: Adede Recheal
people.info: Adede Recheal was the daughter of Simon Wolyan(Kagiri) and his unkwnown wife especially to the Author.

people.name: Adede Na Joseph
people.info: Adede Na Joseph is the first born daughter of Joseph Loguli and his unkwnown wife especially to the Author.

people.name: Lupai Lo Joseph
people.info: Lupai Lo Joseph is the son of Joseph Loguli and his unkwnown wife especially to the Author.

people.name: Poni Esther
people.info: Poni Esther is the first born daughter of Losuba Oliver and Muja Cecelia. She is the mother of Joshua Murye.

people.name: Fraser Loku
people.info: Fraser Loku is a twin son of Losuba Oliver and Muja Cecelia.. He died at a younger age.

people.name: Kenyi Losuba
people.info: Kenyi Losuba is a twin son of Losuba Oliver and Muja Cecelia. He died at a younger age.

people.name: Lupai Sete
people.info: Lupai Sete is a child of Losuba Oliver and Muja Cecelia. He died at younger age.

people.name: Thomas Mogga
people.info: Thomas Mogga is a son of Losuba Oliver and Muja Cecelia.

people.name: Evaline Poni
people.info: Evaline Poni is a daughter of Losuba Oliver and Muja Cecelia.

people.name: Stella Adede
people.info: Stella Adede is a daughter of Losuba Oliver and Muja Cecelia.

people.name: Harriet Kajogo
people.info: Harriet Kajogo is the last born daughter of Losuba Oliver and Muja Cecelia.

people.name: Moju Losuba
people.info: Moju Losuba was the first born child of Losuba Oliver and Esther Woro. He passed away at a young age.

people.name: Kiden Robina
people.info: Kiden Robina is a daughter of Losuba Oliver and Esther Woro. She is the mother of Destiny Jijo.

people.name: Rose Adede
people.info: Rose Adede is a daughter of Losuba Oliver and Esther Woro. She is the mother of Phiona Kiden.

people.name: Keji Scovia
people.info: Keji Scovia is the last born daughter of Losuba Oliver and Esther Woro.

people.name: Kiden Gloria
people.info: Gloria is the first child of Juan Edina and Kenyi Evance

people.name: Reja Christine
people.info: Reja is the child of Juan Edina and Kenyi Evance

people.name: Murye Emmanuel Juan
people.info: Murye Na Edina is the third born child of Juan Edina and Kenyi Evance

people.name: Evaline Jogo
people.info: Evaline Jogo is a child of Juan Edina and Kenyi Evance

people.name: Bulli Samson
people.info: Samson Bulli is a child of Juan Edina and Kenyi Evance

people.name: Poni Beatrice
people.info: Beatrice Poni is the 6th and last born child of Juan Edina and Kenyi Evance

people.name: Kiden Pamela
people.info: Kiden Pamela is the first born child of Simaya Lo'du and Modong Rejoice.

people.name: Gonya Annet
people.info: Gonya Annet is the second born child of Simaya Lo'du and Modong Rejoice.

people.name: Lodu Simaya Lo'du
people.info: Lodu was the child of Simaya Lo'du and Modong Rejoice.

people.name: Murye Joel
people.info: Murye Joel is the child of Simaya Lo'du and Modong Rejoice.

people.name: Jogo Hellen
people.info: Jogo Hellen is the child of Simaya Lo'du and Modong Rejoice.

people.name: Poni Na Simaya
people.info: Poni Na Simaya is the child of Simaya Lo'du and Modong Rejoice.

people.name: Kojo Na Simaya
people.info: Kojo Na Simaya is the child of Simaya Lo'du and Modong Rejoice.

people.name: Munduwa Na Simaya
people.info: Munduwa Simaya is the child of Simaya Lo'du and Suzan Kiko.

people.name: Diko Beatrice
people.info: Diko Beatrice is the child of Simaya Lo'du and Suzan Kiko.

people.name: Pitia Lo Simaya
people.info: Pitia Lo Simaya is the child of Simaya Lo'du and Suzan Kiko.

people.name: Kiden Na Simaya
people.info: Kiden Na Simaya is the child of Simaya Lo'du and Suzan Kiko.

people.name: Kenyi Charles Lupai
people.info: Kenyi Charles is the first born child of Lupai Lawrence and Jane Kaku.

people.name: Murye Emmanuel Lupai
people.info: is the child of Lupai Lawrence and Jane Kaku.

people.name: Unknown child of Lawrence
people.info: The unknown baby girl child of Lupai Lawrence and Jane Kaku died near birth time but was named and the name is what the Author Tella couldn't find out.

people.name: Kiden Sarah Lupai
people.info: Kiden Sarah Lupai also known as Amama is the third and the first daughter of Lupai Lawrence and Jane Kaku.

people.name: Jale David Lupai
people.info: Jale David is the child of Lupai Lawrence and Jane Kaku.

people.name: Bulli Isaac Lupai
people.info: Bulli Isaac is the child of Lupai Lawrence and Jane Kaku.

people.name: Losu Joshua Lupai
people.info: Losu Joshua is the child of Lupai Lawrence and Jane Kaku.

people.name: Kiden Beatrice
people.info: Kiden Beatrice is the first born child of Adede Nancy and Boyo Moses Makur.

people.name: Desire Kiden(Na-wani)
people.info: is the child of Adede Nancy and Boyo Moses Makur.

people.name: Jogo Mercy Boyo
people.info: Jogo Mercy is the third born child of Adede Nancy and Boyo Moses Makur.

people.name: Murye Savior
people.info: Murye Savior is the child of Adede Nancy and Boyo Moses Makur.

people.name: Justo Igga
people.info: Justo Igga is the last born child of Adede Nancy and Boyo Moses Makur.

people.name: Bulli Nelson
people.info: Bulli Nelson is the first born child of Wani Bennard and Robina Apayi.

people.name: Kiden Samirah
people.info: Kiden Samirah is the child of Wani Bennard and the first born child of his second wife Stella Atimaku.

people.name: Murye Bennard
people.info: Murye Bennard is the child of Wani Bennard and Stella Atimaku.

people.name: Milla Bennard
people.info: Milla Bennard is the child of Wani Bennard and Stella Atimaku.

people.name: Bulli Bennard Atimaku
people.info: Bulli Bennard Atimaku is the child of Wani Bennard and Stella Atimaku.

people.name: Moses Pitia
people.info: Moses Pitia is the first born son of Adede Annet, Fathered by Jacob Kamilo.

people.name: Jason Sakor Dilla
people.info: Jason is the second born son of Adede Annet, Fathered by Dilla Theophilus.

people.name: Konga Peggy Dilla
people.info: Konga Peggy Dilla is the third and first born daughter of Adede Annet, Fathered by Dilla Theophilus.

people.name: Phiona Kiden
people.info: Phiona Kiden is the daughter of Rose Adede.

people.name: Joshua Murye
people.info: Joshua Murye is the son of Poni Esther and fathered by Mercy.

people.name: Destiny Jijo
people.info: Destiny Jijo is the daughter of Kiden Robina. She was born on 15 April 2022

people.name: Kenyi Evance
people.info: Evance is the husband of Juan Edina and father to Kiden Gloria, Reja Christine, Murye Emmanuel lo Juan, Evaline Jogo, Bulli Samson and Poni Beatrice. He is hails from the clan of Moje na kolondobong from Lori

people.name: Modong Rejoice Simaya
people.info: Modong Rejoice is the first wife of Lo'du Simaya Azaria and the mother of Kiden Pamela, Annet Gonya, Lodu Lo Lo'du Simaya, Murye Joel, Jogo Hellen, Poni Simaya and lastly Kojo Simaya. She hails from the clan of Korsak palekerot from Kansuk.

people.name: Suzan kiko
people.info: Suzan Kiko is the second wife of Lo'du Simaya Azaria and the mother of Munduwa Simaya, 'Diko Beatrice, Pitia Simaya and lastly Kiden Simaya. She was the daughter of Yoasa Leju from the Pojulu tribe

people.name: Jane Kaku Lupai
people.info: Kaku is the legitimate wife of Lupai Lawrence Azaria and the mother of Kenyi Charles, Emmanuel Murye Lupai, Unknown child of Lupai, Kiden Sarah, Jale David, Bulli Isaac and Losu Joshua. She was the daughter of Daniel Bedeng Benzamin Kenyi the former paramount chief of Nyepo payam who hailed from the clan of Porodong from Lori and his wife Mary Woro Jale from the clan of Korsak palekerot from Lori.

people.name: Boyo Moses Maku
people.info: Boyo Moses is the legitimate husband of Adede Nancy Azaria and the father of Kiden(Na Wani) Beatrice, Desire Kiden(Na Woja), Jogo Mercy, Murye Savior and lastly Justo Igga. He was the son of Maku Yonah of Romogi clan at Kerwa in Liwolo.His mother is Antelia Juan Igga.

people.name: Robina Apayi
people.info: Robina Apayi was the first wife of Wani Bennard and bored Bulli Nelson before they had a divorce. She hails from the wo'gat clan. no more information

people.name: Stella Atimaku
people.info: Stella Atimaku is the current wife of Wani Bennard and the mother of Kiden Samirah, Murye Bennard, Milla Bennard and Bulli Bennard.

people.name: Dilla Theophilus
people.info: Dilla Theophilus is the husband of Adede Annet and father to Jason Sakor Dilla and Peggy Kongo Dilla.
